25320.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Run Redis and RabbitMQ
      ansible.builtin.service:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: started
        enabled: true
      with_items:
        - rabbitmq-server
        - "{{ 'redis' if ansible_os_family == 'RedHat' else 'redis-server' }}"

25322.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Download Jolokia Jar
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: http://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=org/jolokia/jolokia-jvm/1.6.2/jolokia-jvm-1.6.2-agent.jar
        dest: "{{ jolokia_jar_url }}"
    - name: Download Jmx Exporter Jar
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/prometheus/jmx/jmx_prometheus_javaagent/0.12.0/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.12.0.jar
        dest: "{{ jmxexporter_jar_url }}"

25325.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Install missing dependencies
      ansible.builtin.dnf:
        name:
          - sudo
        state: present
        update_cache: true
    - name: Install missing dependencies
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        name:
          - sudo
          - iproute2
          - ca-certificates
        state: present
        update_cache: true

25326.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Install python for Ansible
      ansible.builtin.raw: test -e /usr/bin/python || (apt -y update && apt install
        -y python-minimal)
      become: true
      changed_when: false
    - import_tasks: ../common/prepare.yml

25327.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Install dependencies
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        update_cache: true
        name:
          - locales
          - tzdata
          - apt-transport-https
          - iputils-ping
          - iproute2
          - curl
    - name: Add server to /etc/hosts
      ansible.builtin.shell: echo "{{ hostvars[item].ansible_default_ipv4.address
        }} server {{ item }}" >> /etc/hosts
      with_items: "{{ groups['server'] }}"
      changed_when: false
    - name: Add client server to /etc/hosts
      ansible.builtin.shell: echo "{{ hostvars[item].ansible_default_ipv4.address
        }} client {{ item }}" >> /etc/hosts
      with_items: "{{ groups['client'] }}"
      changed_when: false

25328.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  gather_facts: true
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Setup module loading for network device in /etc/modules-load.d
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        content: e1000
        dest: /etc/modules-load.d/e1000.conf
        mode: 420
      when: ansible_facts.distribution_major_version is version("7", ">=")
    - name: Setup python for ansible
      ansible.builtin.raw: yum install -y libselinux-python
    - name: Setup module loading for network device in /etc/sysconfig/modules
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        content: "#!/bin/sh modprobe e1000 >/dev/null 2>&1"
        dest: /etc/sysconfig/modules/e1000.modules
        mode: 493

25330.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Install packages which are usually present
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        update_cache: true
        name:
          - locales
          - tzdata
          - apt-transport-https
          - python3
          - python3-apt
    - name: Create dirs missing in docker image
      ansible.builtin.file:
        path: /run/lock/
        state: directory
        mode: 493
    - name: Install nginx
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        name: nginx

25338.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    version: 0.19.0
  tasks:
    - name: Download alertmanager binary to local folder
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: https://github.com/prometheus/alertmanager/releases/download/v{{ version
          }}/alertmanager-{{ version }}.linux-amd64.tar.gz
        dest: /tmp/alertmanager-{{ version }}.linux-amd64.tar.gz
      become: false
      register: _download_archive
      until: _download_archive is succeeded
      retries: 5
      delay: 2
      run_once: true
      check_mode: false
    - name: Unpack alertmanager binaries
      ansible.builtin.unarchive:
        src: /tmp/alertmanager-{{ version }}.linux-amd64.tar.gz
        dest: /tmp
        creates: /tmp/alertmanager-{{ version }}.linux-amd64/alertmanager
      become: false
      run_once: true
      check_mode: false
    - name: Link to alertmanager binaries directory
      ansible.builtin.file:
        src: /tmp/alertmanager-{{ version }}.linux-amd64
        dest: /tmp/alertmanager-linux-amd64
        state: link
      become: false
      run_once: true
      check_mode: false

25340.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Remove unneeded arm64 architecture
      ansible.builtin.shell: dpkg --remove-architecture arm64
    - name: Install required armhf architecture
      ansible.builtin.shell: dpkg --add-architecture armhf

25342.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Include tasks
      ansible.builtin.include: "{{ playbook_dir }}/../../tests/tasks/pre.yml"

25346.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  vars:
    pip_install_packages:
      - name: more_itertools<6.0
      - name: docker
      - name: docker_compose
  tasks:
    - name: Install dependencies
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ item }}"
      with_items:
        - python-devel
        - python-virtualenv
        - gcc
        - libffi-devel
    - include_role:
        name: geerlingguy.pip
    - include_role:
        name: geerlingguy.docker

25347.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  become: true
  remote_user: "{{ lookup('env','UNICODA_USER_TO_SWITCH_TO') }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Ensure user to delete is available
      ansible.builtin.user:
        name: "{{ lookup('env','UNICODA_USER_TO_DELETE') }}"
        groups:
          - sudo
        password: test
        state: present
    - name: Ensure sudo group has sudo privileges
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        dest: /etc/sudoers
        state: present
        regexp: ^%sudo
        line: "%sudo ALL=(ALL:ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL"
    - name: Ensure user to delete has passwordless sudo privileges
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        dest: /etc/sudoers
        state: present
        regexp: ^{{ lookup('env','UNICODA_USER_TO_DELETE') }}
        line: "{{ lookup('env','UNICODA_USER_TO_DELETE') }} ALL=(ALL:ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL"

25349.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    ansible_become: false
  tasks:
    - name: Download adv
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: http://{{ hostvars[groups["all"][0]]["ansible_host"] }}:1234/adv
        dest: files/adv

25364.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Wait for aptlock
      ansible.builtin.shell: while fuser /var/lib/apt/lists/lock >/dev/null 2>&1;
        do echo 'Waiting for apt list lock.' && sleep 10; done
      changed_when: false
    - name: Update package cache
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        update_cache: true
    - name: Install gpg dependency
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        name: python3-gpg
        state: present

25366.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - import_role:
        name: variables
    - name: Download Tar
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: "{{confluent_community_archive_url}}"
        dest: "{{ confluent_archive_file_source }}"
    - name: Download CLI tar
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: "{{confluent_cli_archive_url}}"
        dest: "{{ confluent_cli_archive_file_source }}"

25368.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Try to determine OS Family information via raw
      ansible.builtin.raw: uname -s
      register: prepare_uname_kernel_name
      changed_when: false
    - name: Install FreeBSD Python27
      ansible.builtin.raw: test -f /usr/local/bin/python2.7 || /usr/sbin/pkg install
        -y python27
      become: true
      changed_when: false
      when: "'FreeBSD' in prepare_uname_kernel_name.stdout"
    - name: Install OpenBSD Python27
      ansible.builtin.raw: test -f /usr/local/bin/python2.7 || pkg_add -z python-2
      become: true
      changed_when: false
      when: "'OpenBSD' in prepare_uname_kernel_name.stdout"

25370.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts:
    - molecule_hosts_centos_6
    - molecule_hosts_centos_7
  gather_facts: false
  roles:
    - amtega.epel
  tasks:
    - name: Setup virtualenv package
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: python-virtualenv
        state: present
    - name: Setup virtualenv pointing to python2
      ansible.builtin.command: /usr/bin/virtualenv --python=/usr/bin/python --system-site-packages
        {{ packages_python_virtualenv }}
      changed_when: true

25372.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  gather_facts: false
  roles:
    - amtega.git_clone
  tasks:
    - name: Create testing file
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        content: Hello World
        dest: /tmp/git_commit/testing_file
        mode: 416
    - name: Configure git for testing
      community.general.git_config:
        scope: global
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        value: "{{ item.value }}"
      loop:
        - name: user.email
          value: user@acme.com
        - name: user.name
          value: Testing user
      loop_control:
        label: "{{ item.name }}"

25373.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: localectl
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    localectl_locales:
      LANG: en_GB.utf8
    localectl_vc_keymap: xx
    localectl_x11_layout: xx
  roles:
    - role: localectl
  tasks:
    - name: Check that system locale changed to "en_GB.utf8"
      ansible.builtin.command: grep LANG=en_GB.utf8 /etc/locale.conf
      changed_when: false
    - name: Check that system locale changed to "xx"
      ansible.builtin.command: grep KEYMAP="xx" /etc/vconsole.conf
      changed_when: false
    - name: Check that x11 layout changed to "xx"
      ansible.builtin.command: grep 'Option "XkbLayout" "xx"' /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/00-keyboard.conf
      changed_when: false

25374.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  vars:
    platform:
      Darwin:
        become: false
  tasks:
    - name: Full system upgrade
      community.general.pacman:
        update_cache: true
        upgrade: true
      become: true
      when:
        - ansible_os_family == "Archlinux"
    - name: Ensure Git is installed
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: git
        state: present
      become: "{{ platform[ansible_facts.os_family].become | default(True) }}"

25377.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: true
  tasks:
    - name: Ensure test en_gb locale is available in /etc/locale.gen
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/locale.gen
        line: "#en_GB.UTF-8 UTF-8"
        state: present
    - name: Update pacman cache
      ansible.builtin.command: pacman -Sy
      when: ansible_distribution == 'Archlinux'

25380.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Install missing dependencies
      ansible.builtin.yum:
        name:
          - sudo
          - iproute
        state: present
        update_cache: true
    - name: Install missing dependencies
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        name:
          - sudo
          - iproute2
        state: present
        update_cache: true
    - name: Remove file so GitLab Omnibus does not wait for redis server socket on
        task GitLab reconfigure.
      ansible.builtin.file:
        path: /.dockerenv
        state: absent

25383.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Gather variables for each operating system
      ansible.builtin.debug:
        var: ansible_distribution
    - name: Install mysqld server
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: mariadb-server
        state: present
    - name: Start mysql server
      ansible.builtin.systemd:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: started
      ignore_errors: true
      with_items:
        - mysql
        - mysqld
        - mariadb

25384.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  become: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check for Python
      ansible.builtin.raw: test -e /usr/local/bin/python
      changed_when: false
      failed_when: false
      register: check_python
      become: true
    - name: Install python
      ansible.builtin.raw: pkg install -y python
      when: check_python.rc != 0
      become: true
    - name: Install sudo
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: sudo
        state: present
      become: true

25387.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Ensure the locales and tzdata packages are installed
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name:
          - locales
          - tzdata
        update_cache: true
    - name: Ensure the UTF-8 locale is present
      community.general.locale_gen:
        name: en_US.UTF-8
        state: present

25392.oscript:
- name: prepare
  hosts: all
  vars:
    bd_loop: "{{ range(0, 5, 1)|list }}"
  pre_tasks:
    - name: Update apt cache.
      apt: update_cache=true cache_valid_time=600
      when: ansible_os_family == 'Debian'
  handlers:
    - name: link disk.img
      command: losetup /dev/loop{{ item }} /disk{{ item }}.img
      loop: "{{ bd_loop }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Remove existing loop devices
      ansible.builtin.file:
        name: /dev/loop{{ item }}
        state: absent
      loop: "{{ bd_loop }}"
    - name: Create disk.img
      ansible.builtin.command: dd if=/dev/zero of=/disk{{ item }}.img bs=1M count=100
      args:
        creates: /disk{{ item }}.img
      loop: "{{ bd_loop }}"
    - name: Create /dev/loop{{ item }}
      ansible.builtin.command: mknod /dev/loop{{ item }} b 7 {{ 8 + item }}
      args:
        creates: /dev/loop{{ item }}
      notify:
        - link disk.img
      loop: "{{ bd_loop }}"

25395.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Install TLS certificate
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        dest: "{{ item }}"
        group: root
        mode: 420
        owner: root
        src: influxdb-selfsigned.crt
      loop:
        - /etc/ssl/influxdb-selfsigned.crt
        - /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/
    - name: Update trusted certificates
      ansible.builtin.command: update-ca-certificates
    - name: Install TLS key
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        dest: /etc/ssl/influxdb-selfsigned.key
        group: root
        mode: 420
        owner: root
        src: influxdb-selfsigned.key

25397.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: all
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Install ssh
      ansible.builtin.apt:
        name:
          - ssh
        state: present
        update_cache: true
        cache_valid_time: 3600
    - name: Restart ssh
      ansible.builtin.service:
        name: ssh
        state: restarted

25402.oscript:
- name: Prepare
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    go_arch: amd64
    coredns_version: 1.6.6
  tasks:
    - name: Download coredns binary to local folder
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: https://github.com/coredns/coredns/releases/download/v{{ coredns_version
          }}/coredns_{{ coredns_version }}_linux_{{ go_arch }}.tgz
        dest: /tmp/coredns_{{ coredns_version }}_linux_{{ go_arch }}.tgz
      become: false
      register: _download_binary
      until: _download_binary is succeeded
      retries: 5
      delay: 2
      run_once: true
      check_mode: false
    - name: Unpack coredns binary
      ansible.builtin.unarchive:
        src: /tmp/coredns_{{ coredns_version }}_linux_{{ go_arch }}.tgz
        dest: /tmp
        creates: /tmp/coredns
      become: false
      run_once: true
      check_mode: false

name avi upgradestatusinfo create or u.prompt: name avi upgradestatusinfo  create or update upgradestatusinfo

25408.oscript:
- name: Avi UpgradeStatusInfo | Create or Update UpgradeStatusInfo
  avi_upgradestatusinfo:
    controller: "{{ avi_controller | default(omit) }}"
    username: "{{ avi_username | default(omit) }}"
    password: "{{ avi_password | default(omit) }}"
    tenant: "{{ item.tenant | default(omit) }}"

28477.oscript:
- name: Avi SecurityManagerData | Delete SecurityManagerData
  vmware.alb.avi_securitymanagerdata:
    controller: "{{ avi_controller | default(omit) }}"
    username: "{{ avi_username | default(omit) }}"
    password: "{{ avi_password | default(omit) }}"
    tenant: "{{ item.tenant | default(omit) }}"
    api_version: "{{ api_version | default(omit) }}"
    avi_credentials: "{{ avi_credentials | default(omit) }}"
    api_context: "{{ avi_api_context | default(omit) }}"
    state: "{{ avi_role_state_mode }}"
    avi_api_update_method: "{{ item.avi_api_update_method | default(omit) }}"
    avi_api_patch_op: "{{ item.avi_api_patch_op | default(omit) }}"
    app_learning_info: "{{ item.app_learning_info | default(omit) }}"
    name: "{{ item.name | default(omit) }}"
    tenant_ref: "{{ item.tenant_ref | default(omit) }}"
    uuid: "{{ item.uuid | default(omit) }}"
  no_log: "{{ avi_role_config_log_mode | default(False) }}"
  when:
    - (item.name | length > 0)
    - (not (item.system_default | default(false)))
    - (avi_config_state == "absent" or avi_role_state_mode == "absent")
    - (item.state | default("present") == avi_role_state_mode or avi_config_state
      == "absent")
  with_items: "{{ avi_role_cfg.securitymanagerdata | default([]) }}"

    label: "{{ linode_label | default(inventory_hostname) | mandatory }}"

    type: "{{ linode_type | mandatory }}"

28503.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Create molecule instance(s)
      community.general.lxc_container:
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        container_log: false
        template: "{{ item.template }}"
        state: started
        template_options: "{{ item.template_options }}"
        container_command: "{{ item.container_command }}"
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
      register: create_instance
      retries: 10
      until: create_instance is success

28504.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  no_log: "{{ not (lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_DEBUG') | bool or molecule_yml.provisioner.log|default(false)\
    \ | bool) }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Create molecule instance(s)
      community.general.lxd_container:
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        state: started
        source:
          type: image
          mode: pull
          server: https://images.linuxcontainers.org/
          protocol: simplestreams
          alias: "{{ item.image }}"
        devices:
          root:
            path: /
            type: disk
            pool: "{{ lookup('env', 'LXD_POOL') | default('default', true) }}"
        profiles:
          - default
        wait_for_ipv4_addresses: true
        timeout: 6000
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"

28505.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  no_log: "{{ molecule_no_log }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Populate instance config dict
      ansible.builtin.set_fact:
        instance_conf_dict:
          instance: "{{ }}"
          address: "{{ }}"
          user: "{{ }}"
          port: "{{ }}"
          identity_file: "{{ }}"
      with_items: "{{ server.results }}"
      register: instance_config_dict
    - name: Convert instance config dict to a list
      ansible.builtin.set_fact:
        instance_conf: \ "{{ instance_config_dict.results \ | map(attribute='ansible_facts.instance_conf_dict')
          \ | list \ }}"
    - name: Dump instance config
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        content: "# Molecule managed\n\n{{ instance_conf | to_json | from_json | to_yaml\
          \ }}\n"
        dest: "{{ molecule_instance_config }}"
        mode: 384

28506.oscript:

  connection: local

28508.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  no_log: false
  tasks:
    - name: "[Create] Create Molecule LXC instances."
      ansible.builtin.command: lxc launch '{{ item.source.alias }}' '{{ item.name
        }}' -c security.nesting=true -c security.privileged=true
      loop: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
    - name: "[Create] Wait for the container to start."
      ansible.builtin.pause:
        seconds: 15

28509.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    molecule_labels:
      owner: molecule
  tasks:
    - name: Log into a Docker registry
      community.docker.docker_login:
        username: "{{ item.registry.credentials.username }}"
        password: "{{ item.registry.credentials.password }}"
        email: "{{ item.registry.credentials.email | default(omit) }}"
        registry: "{{ item.registry.url }}"
        docker_host: "{{ item.docker_host | default(lookup('env', 'DOCKER_HOST') or\
          \ 'unix://var/run/docker.sock') }}"
        cacert_path: "{{ item.cacert_path | default((lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH')\
          \ + '/ca.pem') if lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') else omit) }}"
        cert_path: "{{ item.cert_path | default((lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH')\
          \ + '/cert.pem')  if lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') else omit) }}"
        key_path: "{{ item.key_path | default((lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') +\
          \ '/key.pem') if lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') else omit) }}"
        tls_verify: "{{ item.tls_verify | default(lookup('env', 'DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY'))\
          \ or false }}"
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
      when:
        - item.registry is defined
        - item.registry.credentials is defined
        - item.registry.credentials.username is defined
    - name: Create molecule instance(s)
      community.docker.docker_container:
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        docker_host: "{{ item.docker_host | default(lookup('env', 'DOCKER_HOST') or\
          \ 'unix://var/run/docker.sock') }}"
        cacert_path: "{{ item.cacert_path | default((lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH')\
          \ + '/ca.pem') if lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') else omit) }}"
        cert_path: "{{ item.cert_path | default((lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH')\
          \ + '/cert.pem')  if lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') else omit) }}"
        key_path: "{{ item.key_path | default((lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') +\
          \ '/key.pem') if lookup('env', 'DOCKER_CERT_PATH') else omit) }}"
        tls_verify: "{{ item.tls_verify | default(lookup('env', 'DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY'))\
          \ or false }}"
        hostname: "{{ item.hostname | default(item.name) }}"
        image: "{{ item.pre_build_image | default('') }}{{ item.image }}"
        pull: "{{ item.pull | default(omit) }}"
        memory: "{{ item.memory | default(omit) }}"
        memory_swap: "{{ item.memory_swap | default(omit) }}"
        state: started
        recreate: false
        log_driver: json-file
        command: "{{ (command_directives_dict | default({}))[item.name] | default(omit)\
          \ }}"
        user: "{{ item.user | default(omit) }}"
        pid_mode: "{{ item.pid_mode | default(omit) }}"
        privileged: "{{ item.privileged | default(omit) }}"
        security_opts: "{{ item.security_opts | default(omit) }}"
        devices: "{{ item.devices | default(omit) }}"
        volumes: "{{ item.volumes | default(omit) }}"
        tmpfs: "{{ item.tmpfs | default(omit) }}"
        capabilities: "{{ item.capabilities | default(omit) }}"
        sysctls: "{{ item.sysctls | default(omit) }}"
        exposed_ports: "{{ item.exposed_ports | default(omit) }}"
        published_ports: "{{ item.published_ports | default(omit) }}"
        ulimits: "{{ item.ulimits | default(omit) }}"
        networks: "{{ item.networks | default(omit) }}"
        network_mode: "{{ item.network_mode | default(omit) }}"
        networks_cli_compatible: "{{ item.networks_cli_compatible | default(true)\
          \ }}"
        purge_networks: "{{ item.purge_networks | default(omit) }}"
        dns_servers: "{{ item.dns_servers | default(omit) }}"
        etc_hosts: "{{ item.etc_hosts | default(omit) }}"
        env: "{{ item.env | default(omit) }}"
        restart_policy: "{{ item.restart_policy | default(omit) }}"
        restart_retries: "{{ item.restart_retries | default(omit) }}"
        tty: "{{ item.tty | default(omit) }}"
        labels: "{{ molecule_labels | combine(item.labels | default({})) }}"
        container_default_behavior: "{{ item.container_default_behavior | default('compatibility'\
          \ if ansible_version.full is version_compare('2.10', '>=') else omit) }}"
      register: server
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
      loop_control:
        label: "{{ item.name }}"
      no_log: false
      async: 7200
      poll: 0
    - name: Wait for instance(s) creation to complete
      ansible.builtin.async_status:
        jid: "{{ item.ansible_job_id }}"
      register: docker_jobs
      until: docker_jobs.finished
      retries: 300
      with_items: "{{ server.results }}"

28516.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  no_log: "{{ not lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_DEBUG') | bool }}"
  vars:
    molecule_file: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_FILE') }}"
    molecule_ephemeral_directory: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_EPHEMERAL_DIRECTORY')\
      \ }}"
    molecule_scenario_directory: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_SCENARIO_DIRECTORY')\
      \ }}"
    molecule_yml: "{{ lookup('file', molecule_file) | molecule_from_yaml }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Create docker network(s)
      community.docker.docker_network:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms | molecule_get_docker_networks }}"
    - name: Create molecule instance(s)
      community.docker.docker_container:
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        hostname: "{{ item.name }}"
        image: "{{ item.image }}"
        state: started
        recreate: false
        log_driver: json-file
        command: '{{ item.command | default(''bash -c "while true; do sleep 10000;
          done"'') }}'
        privileged: "{{ item.privileged | default(omit) }}"
        volumes: "{{ item.volumes | default(omit) }}"
        tmpfs: "{{ item.tmpfs | default(omit) }}"
        capabilities: "{{ item.capabilities | default(omit) }}"
        exposed_ports: "{{ item.exposed_ports | default(omit) }}"
        published_ports: "{{ item.published_ports | default(omit) }}"
        ulimits: "{{ item.ulimits | default(omit) }}"
        networks: "{{ item.networks | default(omit) }}"
        dns_servers: "{{ item.dns_servers | default(omit) }}"
        pull: true
      register: server
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
      async: 7200
      poll: 0
    - name: Wait for instance(s) creation to complete
      ansible.builtin.async_status:
        jid: "{{ item.ansible_job_id }}"
      register: docker_jobs
      until: docker_jobs.finished
      retries: 300
      with_items: "{{ server.results }}"

  no_log: "{{ molecule_no_log }}"
  vars:
    ssh_identity_file: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_EPHEMERAL_DIRECTORY') }}/ssh_key"
    gcp_project_id: "{{ molecule_yml.driver.project_id | default(lookup('env', 'GCE_PROJECT_ID'))\
      \ }}"
  handlers:
    - name: Import main handler tasks
      ansible.builtin.import_tasks: handlers/main.yml
  tasks:
    - name: Make sure the group contains only Linux hosts or Windows hosts
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - molecule_yml.driver.instance_os_type | lower == "linux" or molecule_yml.driver.instance_os_type
            | lower == "windows"
        fail_msg: instance_os_type is possible only to specify linux or windows either
    - name: Include create_linux_instance tasks
      ansible.builtin.include_tasks: tasks/create_linux_instance.yml
      when:
        - molecule_yml.driver.instance_os_type  | lower == "linux"
    - name: Include create_windows_instance tasks
      ansible.builtin.include_tasks: tasks/create_windows_instance.yml
      when:
        - molecule_yml.driver.instance_os_type  | lower == "windows"

28522.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  vars_files:
    - ../../roles/users_and_roles/defaults/main.yml
  pre_tasks:
    - name: Generate templates based on molecule platforms
      template:
        src: "{{ item }}"
        dest: ../es_xpack/{{ item | basename | regex_replace('\.j2$', '') }}
        mode: 420
      with_fileglob:
        - ../es_xpack/templates/*.j2
        - ../es_xpack/templates/.*.j2
  tasks:
    - name: Create ES certificates & cluster
      community.docker.docker_compose:
        project_src: ../es_xpack
        files:
          - create_certs.yml
          - es_cluster.yml
    - name: Wait for elasticsearch to startup
      ansible.builtin.wait_for:
        host: "{{ es_api_host }}"
        port: "{{ es_api_port }}"
        delay: 30 connect_timeout=1
        timeout: "120"

28526.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  no_log: false
  vars:
    TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR: "{{ lookup('env', 'TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR') }}"
    MOLECULE_INSTANCE_CONFIG: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_INSTANCE_CONFIG') }}"
    USER: "{{ lookup('env', 'USER') }}"
  tasks:
    - name: CREATE A INSTANCE
      google.cloud.gcp_compute_instance:
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        machine_type: "{{ item.machine_type }}"
        disks:
          - auto_delete: "true"
            boot: "true"
            initialize_params:
              disk_size_gb: "{{ item.disk_size_gb }}"
              source_image: "{{ item.source_image }}"
        labels:
          environment: molecule
        network_interfaces:
          - network: null
            access_configs:
              - name: External NAT
                type: ONE_TO_ONE_NAT
        zone: "{{ item.zone }}"
        project: "{{ item.project }}"
        auth_kind: serviceaccount
        service_account_file: "{{ TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR }}/credentials.json"
        state: present
      register: hosts
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
    - name: GENERATE instance_config.yml
      ansible.builtin.template:
        src: instance_config.yml.j2
        dest: "{{ MOLECULE_INSTANCE_CONFIG }}"
    - name: Wait 300 seconds for port 22 to become open and contain "OpenSSH"
      ansible.builtin.wait_for:
        host: "{{ item.address }}"
        port: 22
        delay: 10
      with_items: "{{ lookup('file', MOLECULE_INSTANCE_CONFIG) | from_yaml }}"

28528.oscript:
- name: Create
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  no_log: "{{ not lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_DEBUG') | bool }}"
  vars:
    molecule_file: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_FILE') }}"
    molecule_ephemeral_directory: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_EPHEMERAL_DIRECTORY')\
      \ }}"
    molecule_scenario_directory: "{{ lookup('env', 'MOLECULE_SCENARIO_DIRECTORY')\
      \ }}"
    molecule_yml: "{{ lookup('file', molecule_file) | from_yaml }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Create Dockerfiles from image names
      ansible.builtin.template:
        src: "{{ molecule_scenario_directory }}/Dockerfile.j2"
        dest: "{{ molecule_ephemeral_directory }}/Dockerfile_{{ item.image | regex_replace('[^a-zA-Z0-9_]',\
          \ '_') }}"
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"
      register: platforms
    - name: Build an Ansible compatible image
      community.docker.docker_image:
        path: "{{ molecule_ephemeral_directory }}"
        name: molecule_local/{{ item.item.image }}
        dockerfile: "{{ item.item.dockerfile | default(item.invocation.module_args.dest)\
          \ }}"
        force: "{{ item.item.force | default(True) }}"
      with_items: "{{ platforms.results }}"
      when: platforms.changed
    - name: Create molecule instance(s)
      community.docker.docker_container:
        name: "{{ item.name }}"
        hostname: "{{ item.name }}"
        image: molecule_local/{{ item.image }}
        state: started
        recreate: false
        log_driver: syslog
        command: "{{ item.command | default('sleep infinity') }}"
        privileged: "{{ item.privileged | default(omit) }}"
        volumes: "{{ item.volumes | default(omit) }}"
        capabilities: "{{ item.capabilities | default(omit) }}"
      with_items: "{{ molecule_yml.platforms }}"

- name: Delete management root files/directories
  isam:
    appliance: "{{ inventory_hostname }}"
    adminProxyProtocol: "{{ adminProxyProtocol | default(omit) }}"
    adminProxyHostname: "{{ adminProxyHostname | default(omit) }}"
    adminProxyPort: "{{ adminProxyPort | default(omit) }}"
    adminProxyApplianceShortName: "{{ adminProxyApplianceShortName | default(omit)\
      \ }}"
    omitAdminProxy: "{{ omitAdminProxy | default(omit) }}"
    username: "{{ username }}"
    password: "{{ password }}"
    lmi_port: "{{ port | default(omit) }}"
    log: "{{ log_level | default(omit) }}"
    force: "{{ force | default(omit) }}"
    action: ibmsecurity.isam.web.reverse_proxy.management_root.{{ item.1.type }}.delete
    isamapi:
      id: "{{ target }}"
      instance_id: "{{ item.0.inst_name }}"
  with_items: "{{ item.1.targets }}"
  loop_control:
    loop_var: target
    label: "(action: [{{ item.1.action }}], type: [{{ item.1.type }}], inst_name:[{{\
      \ item.0.inst_name }}], target:[{{ target }}])"
  notify: Commit Changes

      instance_id: "{{ item.0.inst_name }}"
  with_items: "{{ item.1.targets }}"

      }}", ''inst_name'': "{{ item.0.inst_name }}", ''target'': "{{ local_target }}"

29157.oscript:
- name: "SCORED | 9.1.1 | PATCH | (L1) Ensure 'Windows Firewall: Domain: Firewall\
    \ state' is set to 'On (recommended)'"
  ansible.windows.win_regedit:
    path: HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsFirewall\DomainProfile
    name: EnableFirewall
    data: 1
    type: dword
  when:
    - rule_9_1_1
  tags:
    - level1-domaincontroller
    - level1-memberserver
    - rule_9.1.1
    - patch

    profile: Domain
  when:

    start_tls: "{{ dirsrv_starttls_early }}"
    bind_dn: "{{ dirsrv_rootdn }}"
    bind_pw: "{{ dirsrv_rootdn_password }}"
    dn: cn={{ item.key }},cn=plugins,cn=config

30743.oscript:

    cmd: microk8s.enable {{ microk8s_plugin.key }}
  with_dict: "{{ microk8s_plugins }}"
  loop_control:
    loop_var: microk8s_plugin
    label: "{{ microk8s_plugin.key }}"
  when:
    - microk8s_plugins is defined
    - microk8s_plugin.value
    - microk8s_plugin.key != "registry"
    - microk8s_plugin.key != "dns"
  register: microk8s_cmd_result
  changed_when:
    - "'Addon {{ microk8s_plugin.key }} is already enabled' not in microk8s_cmd_result.stdout"
  tags:
    - molecule-idempotence-notest
    - microk8s
    - microk8s.plugins
    - microk8s.plugins.enable

30827.oscript:
- name: Create configuration
  ansible.builtin.copy:
    dest: "{{ item.dest }}"
    owner: "{{ consul_user }}"
    group: "{{ consul_group }}"
    content: "{{ lookup('template', 'templates/config.json.j2') | to_nice_json }}"
  with_items:
    - dest: "{{ consul_config_path }}/config.json"
      config_version: "{{ consul_node_role }}"
      when: true
    - dest: "{{ consul_config_path }}/bootstrap.json"
      config_version: bootstrap
      when: "{{ consul_debug | bool }}"
    - dest: "{{ consul_config_path }}/server.json"
      config_version: server
      when: "{{ consul_debug | bool }}"
    - dest: "{{ consul_config_path }}/client.json"
      config_version: client
      when: "{{ consul_debug | bool }}"
  when:
    - item.when
  notify:
    - restart consul

    - dest: "{{ consul_config_path }}/client.json"

      http_port: "{{ add_junction_servers_http_port }}"
      proxy_hostname: "{{ add_junction_servers_proxy_hostname }}"

      sms_environment: "{{ add_junction_servers_sms_environment }}"

  when:

    - add_junction_servers_junction_type is defined

35386.oscript:
- name: Install prometheus
  community.kubernetes.helm:
    name: kube-prometheus
    chart_ref: https://charts.bitnami.com/bitnami/kube-prometheus-5.0.4.tgz
    release_namespace: monitoring
    create_namespace: true
    values:
      prometheus:
        persistence:
          enabled: true
          storageClass: longhorn-replica1-retain
        ingress:
          enabled: true
          hostname: prometheus.{{ domain }}
      node-exporter:
        tolerations:
          - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
            operator: Exists
            effect: NoSchedule
          - key: CriticalAddonsOnly
            operator: Exists
            effect: NoSchedule
        extraArgs:
          collector.filesystem.ignored-mount-points: ^/(dev|proc|sys|var/lib/docker/.+|run/ns/.+|run/k3s/containerd|run|var/lib/kubelet/.+)($|/)
          path.rootfs: /host/root
          log.level: debug
        extraVolumes:
          - name: rootfs
            hostPath:
              path: /
        extraVolumeMounts:
          - name: rootfs
            mountPath: /host/root
            readOnly: true
      alertmanager:
        ingress:
          enabled: true
          hostname: alertmanager.{{ domain }}
    wait: true
    binary_path: "{{ _kube_master['kubernetes']['info']['helm_path'] }}"
    kubeconfig: "{{ _kube_master['kubernetes']['info']['kubeconfig'] }}"

name extract selfsigned certs from hvdb.prompt: name extract selfsigned certs from hvdb database into keystore  item

40182.oscript:
- name: Extract Self-Signed Certs from HVDB Database into keystore {{ item }}
  isam:
    appliance: "{{ inventory_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ username }}"
    password: "{{ password }}"
    lmi_port: "{{ lmi_port }}"
    log: "{{ log_level }}"
    force: "{{ force }}"
    action: ibmsecurity.isam.base.ssl_certificates.signer_certificate.load
    isamapi:
      kdb_id: "{{ item }}"
      label: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_ca_label }}"
      server: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_hvdb_address }}"
      port: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_hvdb_port }}"
  with_items: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_keystores }}"
  when: externalize_hvdb_db2_keystores is defined and externalize_hvdb_db2_ca_label
    is defined
  notify: Commit Changes

40184.oscript:
- name: Extract Self-Signed Certs from HVDB Database into keystore {{ item }}
  ibm.isam.isam:
    log: "{{ log_level | default('INFO') }}"
    force: "{{ force | default(False) }}"
    action: ibmsecurity.isam.base.ssl_certificates.signer_certificate.load
    isamapi:
      kdb_id: "{{ item }}"
      label: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_ca_label }}"
      server: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_hvdb_address }}"
      port: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_hvdb_port }}"
  with_items: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_keystores }}"
  when: externalize_hvdb_db2_keystores is defined and externalize_hvdb_db2_ca_label
    is defined
  notify: Commit Changes

40602.oscript:
- name: testing
  hosts: localhost
  connection: local
  gather_facts: false
  become: false
  tasks:
    - name: Create a check named "test hourly"
      community.healthchecksio.checks:
        state: present
        name: test hourly
        unique:
          - name
        tags:
          - test
          - hourly
        desc: my hourly test check
        schedule: 0 * * * *
        tz: UTC
    - name: Create a simple check named "test simple"
      community.healthchecksio.checks:
        state: present
        name: test simple
        unique:
          - name
        tags:
          - test
          - simple
        desc: my simple test check
        timeout: 333
    - name: Create a simple check named "test simple"
      community.healthchecksio.checks:
        state: present
        name: test simple
        unique:
          - name
        tags:
          - test
          - simple
        desc: my simple test check
        timeout: 333
        schedule: 0 * * * *

42000.oscript:
- name: Configure SSHD
  ansible.builtin.template:
    src: templates/sshd_config.j2
    dest: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: "0600"
    validate: /usr/sbin/sshd -t -f %s
    backup: true
  notify:
    - restart sshd

42012.oscript:
- name: Configure sshd
  ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
    dest: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: "0644"
    backup: true
    create: true
    validate: sshd -t -f %s
    regexp: "{{ item.regexp }}"
    line: "{{ item.line }}"
    state: present
  with_items:
    - regexp: ^\#?Port\s+(.*)$
      line: Port {{ sshd_port }}
    - regexp: ^\#?Protocol\s+(.*)$
      line: Protocol {{ sshd_protocol }}
    - regexp: ^\#?PermitRootLogin\s+(.*)$
      line: PermitRootLogin {{ sshd_permitrootlogin }}
    - regexp: ^\#?PermitEmptyPasswords\s+(.*)$
      line: PermitEmptyPasswords {{ sshd_permitemptypasswords }}
    - regexp: ^\#?PasswordAuthentication\s+(.*)$
      line: PasswordAuthentication {{ sshd_passwordauthentication }}
    - regexp: ^\#?GSSAPIAuthentication\s+(.*)$
      line: GSSAPIAuthentication {{ sshd_gssapiauthentication }}
    - regexp: ^\#?PubkeyAuthentication\s+(.*)$
      line: PubkeyAuthentication {{ sshd_pubkeyauthentication }}
  notify: restart sshd

42142.oscript:
- name: Create EC2 instances for node1
  amazon.aws.ec2_instance:
    state: running
    network:
      assign_public_ip: true
    key_name: "{{ ec2_name_prefix }}-key"
    security_group: "{{ ec2_security_group }}"
    instance_type: "{{ ec2_info[rhel].size }}"
    image_id: "{{ node_ami_rhel.image_id }}"
    region: "{{ ec2_region }}"
    exact_count: "{{ student_total }}"
    filters:
      instance-state-name: running
      tag:Workshop_node1: "{{ ec2_name_prefix }}-node1"
    tags:
      Workshop_node1: "{{ ec2_name_prefix }}-node1"
      Workshop: "{{ ec2_name_prefix }}"
      uuid: "{{ ec2_name_prefix }}"
      guid: "{{ ec2_name_prefix }}"
      Workshop_type: "{{ workshop_type }}"
      AWS_USERNAME: "{{ aws_user }}"
      owner: "{{ aws_user }}"
      Info: AWS_USERNAME that provisioned this-> {{ aws_user }}
      Linklight: This was provisioned through the linklight provisioner
      Students: "{{ student_total }}"
      short_name: node1
      username: "{{ ec2_info[rhel].username }}"
      ansible-workshops: "true"
    wait: "{{ ec2_wait }}"
    vpc_subnet_id: "{{ ec2_vpc_subnet_id }}"
    volumes:
      - device_name: /dev/sda1
        ebs:
          volume_type: "{{ ec2_info[rhel].disk_volume_type }}"

name configure tcp retries2 for db2 fai.prompt: name configure tcp retries2 for db2 failovers

42815.oscript:
- name: Configure TCP Retries2 for DB2 Failovers
  isam:
    appliance: "{{ inventory_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ username }}"
    password: "{{ password }}"
    lmi_port: "{{ lmi_port }}"
    log: "{{ log_level }}"
    force: "{{ force }}"
    action: ibmsecurity.isam.base.advanced_tuning_parameters.set
    isamapi:
      key: sysctl.net.ipv4.tcp_retries2
      value: "{{ externalize_hvdb_db2_tcp_retries2 }}"
      comment: TCP Tuning to allow for Quicker/Predictable DB2 Failovers
  when: externalize_hvdb_db2_hvdb_address is defined
  notify:
    - Commit Changes
    - Restart AAC Runtime
    - Restart LMI

42817.oscript:

    isamapi:

      comment: TCP Tuning to allow for Quicker/Predictable DB2 Failovers
  when: externalize_hvdb_db2_hvdb_address is defined
  notify:
    - Commit Changes
    - Restart AAC Runtime
    - Restart LMI

42939.oscript:
- name: Manage pyenv git dependencies
  ansible.builtin.dnf:
    conf_file: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution].package_manager.conf_file\
      \ | default(omit) }}"
    disable_gpg_check: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution].package_manager.disable_gpg_check\
      \ | default(omit) }}"
    disablerepo: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution].package_manager.disablerepo\
      \ | default(omit) }}"
    enablerepo: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution].package_manager.enablerepo\
      \ | default(omit) }}"
    installroot: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution].package_manager.installroot\
      \ | default(omit) }}"
    name: "{{ pyenv_git_dependency }}"
    state: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies_state }}"
  become: true
  loop_control:
    loop_var: pyenv_git_dependency
  register: pyenv_git_dependencies_status
  with_items: "{{ pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution].packages\
    \ }}"
  when: "hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution == 'Fedora' and (hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution_major_version\
    \ | int) >= 22 and pyenv_git_dependencies is mapping and pyenv_git_dependencies[hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_distribution]\

  tags:
    - dependencies
    - git

46330.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  gather_facts: false
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Get replica status
      community.mysql.mysql_replication:
        mode: getreplica
        login_user: "{{ mysql_root_user }}"
        login_password: "{{ mysql_root_password }}"
      register: mysql_verify_replication
    - name: Make sure replication is working
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - mysql_verify_replication.Replica_IO_Running == "Yes"
          - mysql_verify_replication.Replica_SQL_Running == "Yes"
          - mysql_verify_replication.Seconds_Behind_Source == 0
          - mysql_verify_replication.Replica_IO_State is search("Waiting for")
          - mysql_verify_replication.Replica_SQL_Running_State is search("read all
            relay log")

46331.oscript:

  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Test Alertmanager is up on the Default Port
      ansible.builtin.wait_for:
        port: 9094
    - name: Test the alertmanager package is versionlocked.
      ansible.builtin.command:
        cmd: yum versionlock list | grep alertmanager
        warn: false

46332.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  tasks:
    - name: Check that all epel repositories are disabled
      ansible.builtin.command: grep 'enabled=1' {{ epel_config_file }} {{ epel_testing_config_file
        }}
      register: check_enabled_options
      failed_when: check_enabled_options.rc != 1 or check_enabled_options.stdout |
        length > 0
      changed_when: false

46334.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: "{{ lookup('env', 'DEVAP_TEST_PLATFORM') | default('all') }}"
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Discover platform
      ansible.builtin.setup:
        gather_subset: min
        gather_timeout: "10"
    - name: Load role variables
      ansible.builtin.include_role:
        public: true
        name: sys_kernel
    - name: Verify that core variables are set
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - sys_kernel_platforms is defined
          - sys_kernel_tunables is defined

46335.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Verify Babashka is installed
      ansible.builtin.command: /usr/local/bin/bb --version
      changed_when: false
      register: bb_version
    - name: Assert installed
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'babashka' in '{{ bb_version.stdout}}'"
        success_msg: Yes, Babashka has been installed.
        fail_msg: Babashka does NOT exist!

46337.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Check url
      ansible.builtin.uri:
        url: http://{{ ansible_host }}:8080/login
        return_content: true
        validate_certs: false
      register: uri_result
    - name: Check content
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'Welcome to Jenkins!' in uri_result.content"
    - name: Show Jenkins version
      ansible.builtin.debug:
        var: uri_result.x_jenkins

46338.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Example assertion
      ansible.builtin.fail:
        msg: true

46339.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Execute packer version to capture output
      ansible.builtin.command: packer --version
      register: packer_current_version
      changed_when: false
    - name: Ensure packer version output contains correct version string
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - packer_current_version.rc == 0
    - name: Ensure packer is correct version
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'1.8.0' in packer_current_version.stdout"

46341.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Gather package facts
      ansible.builtin.package_facts:
        manager: auto
    - name: Verify Packages
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that: "'check-mk-agent' in ansible_facts.packages"
    - name: Verify service listen ok
      ansible.builtin.wait_for:
        port: 6556
        timeout: 3

46342.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check binary file
      ansible.builtin.stat:
        path: /usr/bin/google-chrome
      register: bin
    - name: Assert that Google Chrome is installed
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - bin.stat.exists

46343.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  gather_facts: false
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Read /etc/sysctl file
      ansible.builtin.command: cat /etc/sysctl.conf
      changed_when: false
      register: read_main_sysctl_result
    - name: Read /etc/sysctl.d/50-hardlinks.conf file
      ansible.builtin.command: cat /etc/sysctl.d/50-hardlinks.conf
      changed_when: false
      register: read_hardlinks_sysctl_result
    - name: Check that sysctl configs are present
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - read_main_sysctl_result.stdout is search("kernel.printk=3 4 1 7")
          - read_hardlinks_sysctl_result.stdout is search("fs.protected_hardlinks=1")

46345.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: mock_server
  connection: local
  tasks:
    - name: Check that the component request was sent to the mock controller exactly
        4 times per docker instance (includes the idempotence test)
      ansible.builtin.uri:
        url: https://{{ inventory_hostname }}:1080/mockserver/verify
        method: PUT
        body:
          httpRequest:
            path: /api/v1/services/environments/production/apps/www.example.com/components/root
          times:
            atLeast: 4
            atMost: 4
        status_code: 202
        body_format: json
        headers:
          Content-Type: application/json
        validate_certs: false

46347.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check cloud-init status
      ansible.builtin.command: cloud-init status
      register: command_result
      changed_when: false
      failed_when: "command_result.stdout != 'status: not run'"
    - name: Check config file sha
      ansible.builtin.stat:
        path: /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg
        checksum_algorithm: sha1
      register: stat
      failed_when: stat.stat.checksum != '3b53e8061f3ca95264eb2b81a263ebe43ee3ee8a'

46348.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Example assertion
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that: true

46349.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Test that Caddy is running
      ansible.builtin.uri:
        url: http://127.0.0.1
        status_code: 200
        return_content: true
      register: result
      until:
        - result.status == 200
        - result.content is regex('Caddy (works!|web server)')
      retries: 10
      delay: 5
    - name: List Caddy modules
      ansible.builtin.command: caddy list-modules
      changed_when: false
      register: caddy_modules
    - name: Check for custom modules
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'cloudflare' in caddy_modules.stdout"

46350.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Include role variables
      ansible.builtin.include_vars: ../../defaults/main.yml
    - name: "...that this is always true and must be replaced with more real test\
        \ cases"
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that: true

46353.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Install Prometheus
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: prometheus2
        state: present
      become: true
    - name: Install Node Exporter

46359.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  vars_files:
    - ../../defaults/main.yml
  tasks:
    - name: Check current version installed
      ansible.builtin.shell: "{{ azcopy_bin_path }}/azcopy --version 2>&1 | head -n\
        \ 1 | grep {{ azcopy_version }}"
      failed_when: false
      changed_when: false
      register: version
    - name: Check installation
      ansible.builtin.fail:
        msg: azcopy {{ azcopy_version }} installation failure
      when: version.rc != 0
    - name: Display version installed
      ansible.builtin.debug:
        msg: "{{ version.stdout_lines }} is installed."

46360.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Gather services facts
      ansible.builtin.service_facts: null
    - name: Assert that etcd service are enabled and running state
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - ansible_facts.services['etcd.service'].status == 'enabled'
          - ansible_facts.services['etcd.service'].state == 'running'
    - name: Show cluster member list
      ansible.builtin.shell:
        cmd: /usr/local/bin/etcdctl --cacert=/etc/etcd/ca.pem --cert=/etc/etcd/etcd-client.pem
          --key=/etc/etcd/etcd-client.key member list
        warn: false
      changed_when: false
      tags:
        - skip_ansible_lint

46362.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Include test_dotfiles
      ansible.builtin.include_role:
        name: test_dotfiles

46363.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Populate service facts
      ansible.builtin.service_facts: null
    - name: Ensure ssh is running
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that: (ansible_facts.services.ssh is defined) and (ansible_facts.services.ssh.state
          == 'running')
    - name: Ensure SSH Settings are proper
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
        regexp: ^{{ item }}
        line: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
      check_mode: true
      register: conf
      with_items:
        - PasswordAuthentication no
        - PermitRootLogin no
        - Port 22
        - PermitTunnel no
      failed_when: (conf is changed) or (conf is failed)

46364.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: panel
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Get panel homepage
      ansible.builtin.get_url:
        url: https://127.0.0.1
        dest: /tmp/index.html
        validate_certs: false
    - name: Get homepage contents
      ansible.builtin.command: cat /tmp/index.html
      changed_when: false
      register: pterodactyl_panel_page
    - name: Verify that homepage was loaded
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - '"Pterodactyl" in pterodactyl_panel_page.stdout'

46365.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  become: true
  become_user: root
  become_method: sudo
  tasks:
    - name: Gather MySQL users.
      community.mysql.mysql_info:
        filter: databases,users
        return_empty_dbs: true
        login_unix_socket: /run/mysqld/mysqld.sock
      register: mu
    - name: Check the size of ibdata1
      ansible.builtin.stat:
        path: /var/lib/mysql/ibdata1
      register: st
    - assert:
        that:
          - "'appuser' in mu['users']['localhost']"
          - "'appdata' in mu['databases']"
          - st.stat.size == 10485760

46366.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Test if the postgres 10 is running
      ansible.builtin.shell: psql -c "SELECT version();"
      args:
        executable: /bin/bash
      register: postgresql_version
      become: true
      become_user: postgres
      become_method: sudo
      changed_when: false
      failed_when:
        - '"PostgreSQL 10" not in postgresql_version.stdout'

46367.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Look for installed cron job
      ansible.builtin.stat:
        path: /etc/cron.d/certbot
      register: certbot_st
      failed_when: not certbot_st.stat.exists

46369.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check ssh service

        name: sshd
        state: started

46371.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Pause to wait for chrony synchronization
      ansible.builtin.pause:
        minutes: 1
    - name: Check if chrony is running an synchronized
      ansible.builtin.command: chronyc tracking
      register: chrony_check
      changed_when: false
      failed_when: chrony_check.stdout is search("Not synchronised")

46372.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Waits for SSH Port
      ansible.builtin.wait_for:
        port: 22
        state: started

46373.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check if connection still works
      ansible.builtin.ping: null
    - name: Check if AllowUsers is set
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
        line: AllowUsers root
      check_mode: true
      register: openssh_check_if_allowusers_is_set
      failed_when:
        - openssh_check_if_allowusers_is_set is changed
    - name: Check if AllowGroups is set
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
        line: AllowGroups root
      check_mode: true
      register: openssh_check_if_allowgroups_is_set
      failed_when:
        - openssh_check_if_allowgroups_is_set is changed

46374.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Ensure ssh key is present
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /root/.ssh/authorized_keys
        regexp: ^{{ item }}(.*)$
        line: "{{ item }}\\1"
        state: present
        backrefs: true
      check_mode: true
      register: line_in_file
      failed_when: (line_in_file.changed) or (line_in_file.failed)
      loop:
        - ssh-ed25519 AAAAC3NzaC1lZDI1NTE5AAAAIJi3wBlOT+oR8Rd+YQsV8tUoQOd3NSUuyzJYQp8finD6
          john@example.com
        - ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAADAQABAAAAgQDXkvy8jMmw45grnmYK+Ylk/mcc7IyG9taNseNiVrGjR8KRHVJpzEntW1g6SAomIGIpBLvviiyhal4E1v1bhpv2JopbiM3JDOck6gwc4AfpanjuZFPuq6stq5pF7bb2C+zliw16zTFL7bp09tD7nNs30GlchB5DU2sSn1zq4iC+eQ==
          john@example.com

46380.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  gather_facts: true
  vars_files: ../../vars/main.yml
  roles:
    - role: ansible-role-mysql
      mysql_users:
        - name: my_user
      mysql_databases:
        - name: my_db
          state: dump
          target: /tmp/my_db.mysql
  vars:
    _netstat_package:
      default: net-tools
      Suse: net-tools-deprecated
    netstat_package: "{{ _netstat_package[ansible_os_family] | default(_netstat_package['default'])\
      \ }}"
  handlers:
    - name: remove netstat
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ netstat_package }}"
        state: absent
  tasks:
    - name: Install netstat
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ netstat_package }}"
        state: present
      notify:
        - remove netstat
    - name: Check if mysql is bound to 127.0.0.1
      ansible.builtin.command:
        cmd: netstat -tulpen
      register: mysql_netstat
      failed_when:
        - '"127.0.0.1" not in mysql_netstat.stdout'
    - name: Try root account
      community.mysql.mysql_db:
        name: my_test
        state: present
        login_unix_socket: "{{ mysql_socket }}"
        login_user: root
        login_password: "{{ mysql_root_password }}"

46381.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  vars_files:
    - ../../defaults/main.yml
  tasks:
    - name: Get installed version
      ansible.builtin.command: gh --version
      register: installed_version
      changed_when: false
    - name: Debug
      ansible.builtin.debug:
        var: installed_version.stdout_lines[0]
    - name: Example assertion
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - gh_version in installed_version.stdout_lines[0]

46382.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Load Scenario Variables
      ansible.builtin.include_vars: vars/main.yml
    - name: Read Variables from Test Run
      ansible.builtin.slurp:
        src: "{{ jumpcloud_agent_location }}"
      register: results
    - name: Check Mock Install Arguments (confirm it's been installed twice!)
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - results.content | b64decode == "Mock Previous Install\n-s -k secret_jumpcloud_key\n"

46383.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: install
  tasks:
    - name: Get Services facts
      ansible.builtin.service_facts: null
    - name: Check if firewalld is running
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - ansible_facts.services['firewalld.service'].status == 'enabled'
          - ansible_facts.services['firewalld.service'].state == 'running'
    - name: Try to insert a rule
      ansible.posix.firewalld:
        service: https
        permanent: true
        state: enabled

46384.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  connection: local
  tasks:
    - name: Detect git change in tracked files
      ansible.builtin.shell:
        cmd: git status --short | grep -e "^ M" | wc -l | awk -F ' ' '{print $1}'
      delegate_to: 127.0.0.1
      register: git_status
    - name: Fail if change detected
      ansible.builtin.debug:
        msg: Change detected in output. Please check ! Found {{ git_status.stdout
          }} changes
      delegate_to: 127.0.0.1

46385.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Darwin | Amazon ssm agent service should be started and enabled
      community.general.launchd:
        name: com.amazon.aws.ssm
        state: started
        enabled: true
      register: ssm_service_result
    - name: Darwin | Verify commands outputs
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - not ssm_service_result.changed
        success_msg: All tests passed

46386.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check binary version
      ansible.builtin.command:
        cmd: /usr/bin/prometheus --version
      register: bin_version
      failed_when: prometheus_version not in bin_version.stderr
      vars:
        prometheus_version: 2.24.1
    - name: Check HTTP
      ansible.builtin.uri:
        url: http://localhost:9090
    - name: Check versionlock
      ansible.builtin.command:
        argv:
          - dnf
          - versionlock
          - list
      register: out
      failed_when: '"prometheus" not in out.stdout'

46387.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - include_vars:
        file: ../../vars/main.yml
        name: inventory
    - name: Include get_access_control_policies
      ansible.builtin.include_role:
        name: get_access_control_policies
      vars:
        get_access_control_policies:
          - name: "{{ inventory.molecule_name }}"
    - name: Assert that policy description was updated
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - ret_obj.results.0.data.name == inventory.molecule_name
          - ret_obj.results.0.data.description == inventory.molecule_update_description
        fail_msg: Policy description was not updated
        success_msg: Policy description was updated

46388.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Check Installed a Remi Repository.
      ansible.builtin.package_facts:
        manager: auto
    - name: Test if EPEL Repository is installed.
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'epel-release' in ansible_facts.packages"
      when: ansible_distribution == "CentOS" or ansible_distribution == "RedHat"
    - name: Test if Remi Repository is installed.
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'remi-release' in ansible_facts.packages"

46389.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Gather the package facts
      ansible.builtin.package_facts:
        manager: auto
    - name: Populate service facts
      ansible.builtin.service_facts: null

46392.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    molecule_name: test2
  tasks:
    - name: Include get_access_policies
      ansible.builtin.include_role:
        name: get_access_policies_by_name
      vars:
        get_access_policies:
          - name: "{{ molecule_name }}"
    - name: Assert that attribute {{ molecule_name }} is added
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - ret_obj.results.0.data.name is defined
          - ret_obj.results.0.data.name == molecule_name
        fail_msg: Access Policy {{ molecule_name }} was not added
        success_msg: Access Policy {{ molecule_name }} was added

46396.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  pre_tasks:
    - name: Include variables.
      include_vars: vars/main.yml
  tasks:
    - name: Verify User Groups
      ansible.builtin.group:
        name: "{{ item.suu_groups_name }}"
        gid: "{{ item.suu_groups_gid | default(omit) }}"
        state: "{{ item.suu_groups_state | default(omit) }}"
      with_items: "{{ suu_groups }}"
      check_mode: true
      register: result1
      failed_when: result1.changed
    - name: Verify User Accounts
      ansible.builtin.user:
        name: "{{ item.setup_users_name }}"
        comment: "{{ item.setup_users_comment | default(omit) }}"
        state: "{{ item.setup_users_state | default(omit) }}"
        shell: "{{ item.setup_users_shell | default(omit) }}"
      with_items: "{{ users }}"
      check_mode: true
      register: result2
      failed_when: result2.changed

46397.oscript:
- name: Verify

  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Windows | Amazon ssm agent service should be started and enabled
      ansible.windows.win_service:
        name: AmazonSSMAgent
        start_mode: auto
        state: started
      register: ssm_service_result
    - name: Windows | Verify commands outputs

46404.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: mock_server
  connection: local
  tasks:
    - name: Check that the user GET request was sent to the mock controller exactly
        2 times per docker instance (includes the idempotence test)
      ansible.builtin.uri:
        url: https://{{ inventory_hostname }}:1080/mockserver/verify
        method: PUT
        body:
          httpRequest:
            path: /api/v1/platform/users/bob@example.com
          times:
            atLeast: 2
            atMost: 2
        status_code: 202
        body_format: json
        headers:
          Content-Type: application/json
        validate_certs: false
    - name: Check that the user POST request was sent to the mock controller exactly
        2 times per docker instance (includes the idempotence test)
      ansible.builtin.uri:
        url: https://{{ inventory_hostname }}:1080/mockserver/verify
        method: PUT
        body:
          httpRequest:
            path: /api/v1/platform/users
          times:
            atLeast: 2
            atMost: 2
        status_code: 202
        body_format: json
        headers:
          Content-Type: application/json
        validate_certs: false

46409.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Watting for sentinel service started
      ansible.builtin.wait_for:
        host: 0.0.0.0
        port: 26379
        state: started
        timeout: 10
    - name: Get master addr by name
      ansible.builtin.command: /usr/local/bin/redis-cli -h 127.0.0.1 -p 26379 sentinel
        get-master-addr-by-name master
      register: __master_addr
      run_once: true
    - name: Test master ping
      ansible.builtin.command: /usr/local/bin/redis-cli -h {{ __master_addr.stdout_lines[0]
        }} -p {{ __master_addr.stdout_lines[1] }} ping

46410.oscript:

  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Include vars
      ansible.builtin.include_vars: "{{ playbook_dir }}/../../defaults/main.yml"
    - name: Include tasks
      ansible.builtin.include: "{{ playbook_dir }}/../../tests/tasks/post.yml"

46418.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Check nodejs version
      ansible.builtin.shell: node --version
      register: nodejs_current_version
      changed_when: false
      args:
        executable: /bin/bash
    - name: Ensure nodejs is installed
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - nodejs_current_version.rc == 0
    - name: Ensure nodejs is correct version
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        that:
          - "'v12.' in nodejs_current_version.stdout"

46420.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Check docker group configuration
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/group
        regex: ^docker:x:\d*:woody,buzz$
        state: absent
      check_mode: true
      register: docker_group
      changed_when: not docker_group is changed
      failed_when: docker_group is changed
    - name: Create a container
      community.docker.docker_container:
        name: openssh
        image: buluma/docker-centos-openssh
        ports:
          - "2222:22"
      when:
        - ansible_connection not in [ "container", "docker", "community.docker.docker"
          ]
    - name: Make sure we are not running podman
      ansible.builtin.command:
        cmd: docker --version
      register: docker_test_one
      failed_when:
        - '"podman" in docker_test_one.stdout'

        line: Storage=persistent
        regexp: ^Storage=persistent$
        state: present
      check_mode: true
      register: line_storage
      failed_when: line_storage is changed or line_storage is failed
    - name: Check that default value stay commented
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        name: /etc/systemd/journald.conf
        line: "#Seal=yes"
        regexp: ^#Seal=yes$
        state: present
      check_mode: true
      register: line_seal
      failed_when: line_seal is changed or line_seal is failed

46505.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  gather_facts: true
  vars:
    _ntp_check_packages:
      default:
        - ntpstat
      Amazon-2: []
      RedHat: &id001 []
      Rocky: *id001
    ntp_check_packages: "{{ _ntp_check_packages[ansible_distribution ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_ntp_check_packages[ansible_os_family ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_ntp_check_packages[ansible_os_family] | default(_ntp_check_packages['default'])))\
      \ }}"
    _ntp_check_command:
      default: ntpstat
      Amazon-2: chronyc tracking
      Amazon-2018: chronyc tracking
      RedHat-8: chronyc tracking
      Rocky-8: chronyc tracking
      Fedora: chronyc tracking
    ntp_check_command: "{{ _ntp_check_command[ansible_distribution ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_ntp_check_command[ansible_os_family ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_ntp_check_command[ansible_distribution] | default(_ntp_check_command['default'])))\
      \ }}"
    _ntp_success_output:
      default: synchronised to NTP server
      Amazon-2: "Leap status     : Normal"
      Amazon-2018: "Leap status     : Normal"
      RedHat-8: "Leap status     : Normal"
      Rocky-8: "Leap status     : Normal"
      Fedora: "Leap status     : Normal"
    ntp_success_output: "{{ _ntp_success_output[ansible_distribution ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_ntp_success_output[ansible_os_family ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_ntp_success_output[ansible_distribution] | default(_ntp_success_output['default'])))\
      \ }}"
    ntp_state: stopped
  tasks:
    - name: Install ntp check packages
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ ntp_check_packages }}"
        state: present
      register: ntp_install_ntp_check_packages
    - name: Check if time is synchronised
      ansible.builtin.command:
        cmd: "{{ ntp_check_command }}"
      register: npt_check_time_synchronised
      failed_when:
        - ntp_success_output not in npt_check_time_synchronised.stdout
      changed_when: false
      until:
        - npt_check_time_synchronised is succeeded
      retries: 16
      when:
        - ntp_state == "started"
    - name: Uninstall ntp check packages
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ ntp_check_packages }}"
        state: absent
      when:
        - ntp_install_ntp_check_packages is changed

46506.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: true
  tasks:
    - name: Test if sources files exists
      ansible.builtin.stat:
        path: /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{{ item }}-proxy.list
      loop:
        - "{{ ansible_distribution_release | lower }}"
        - "{{ ansible_distribution_release | lower }}-security"
        - "{{ ansible_distribution_release | lower }}-updates"
      register: file_stat
      failed_when: not file_stat.stat.exists
    - name: Check if deb string is present in main file
      ansible.builtin.shell: cat /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{{ item }}-proxy.list
      register: presence
      loop:
        - "{{ ansible_distribution_release | lower }}"
        - "{{ ansible_distribution_release | lower }}-security"
        - "{{ ansible_distribution_release | lower }}-updates"
      failed_when: not presence.stdout.startswith("deb")
      changed_when: false
    - debug:
        var: presence

    sysctl_conf_location: /etc/sysctl.conf
  tasks:
    - name: Check ipv4 forwarding is enabled permanently
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: "{{ sysctl_conf_location }}"
        regexp: "#net.ipv4.ip_forward=1"
        line: net.ipv4.ip_forward=1
      register: perm_result
      failed_when: perm_result.changed
    - name: Save iptables file location to variable
      ansible.builtin.stat:
        path: "{{ iptables_persistent_location }}"
      register: stat_result
      failed_when: not stat_result.stat.exists
    - name: Check content of iptables file
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        src: ./molecule/files/rules.v4.compare
        dest: "{{ iptables_persistent_location }}"
      check_mode: true
      register: content_result
      failed_when: content_result.changed

46536.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  gather_facts: false
  pre_tasks:
    - name: Gather facts from all hosts
      include_tasks: includes/gather_all_hosts_facts.yml
  tasks:
    - name: Add openssl command
      ansible.builtin.yum:
        name: openssl
        state: present
    - name: Check certificate alias in ca-bundle.trust.crt
      ansible.builtin.shell: cat /etc/pki/ca-trust/extracted/openssl/ca-bundle.trust.crt
        | awk -v cmd='openssl x509 -inform PEM -noout -alias' '/BEGIN/{close(cmd)};{print
        | cmd}'
      register: certificate_check_result
      tags:
        - skip_ansible_lint
    - name: Assert certificate alias in ca-bundle.trust.crt
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        quiet: true
        that: (cert.alias in certificate_check_result.stdout) | bool
        fail_msg: ❌ {{ cert.alias }} not found in ca-bundle.trust.crt
        success_msg: ✅ {{ cert.alias }} in ca-bundle.trust.crt
      loop: "{{ ca_certificates }}"
      loop_control:
        loop_var: cert
        label: "{{ cert['alias'] }}"

46570.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  tasks:
    - name: Validate securetty file for existence of items
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/securetty
        line: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
      register: securetty_validation_exists
      failed_when: securetty_validation_exists is changed
      loop:
        - console
        - vc/1
        - vc/2
        - vc/3
        - vc/4
        - vc/5
        - vc/6
        - vc/7
        - vc/8
        - vc/9
        - vc/10
        - vc/11
        - tty1
        - tty2
        - tty3
        - tty4
        - tty5
        - tty6
        - tty7
        - tty8
        - tty9
        - tty10
        - tty11
    - name: Validate securetty file for non-existence of items
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/securetty
        line: "{{ item }}"
        state: absent
      register: securetty_validation_not_exists
      failed_when: securetty_validation_not_exists is changed
      loop:
        - ttyS0
        - ttysclp0
        - sclp_line0
        - 3270/tty1
        - hvc[0-9]+
        - hvc1
        - hvc2
        - hvc3
        - hvc4
        - hvc5
        - hvc6
        - hvc7
        - hvsi0
        - hvsi1
        - hvsi2
        - xvc0
    - name: Validate ICMP Redirects are disabled
      ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
        path: /etc/sysctl.conf
        line: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
      register: sysctl_icmp_redir_validation
      failed_when: sysctl_icmp_redir_validation is changed
      loop:
        - net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects=0
        - net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects=0
        - net.ipv4.conf.all.secure_redirects=0
        - net.ipv4.conf.default.secure_redirects=0

46583.oscript:
- name: Verify
  hosts: all
  become: true
  gather_facts: true
  vars:
    _tftp_directory:
      default: /var/lib/tftpboot
      Debian: /srv/tftp
      Ubuntu-18: /var/lib/tftpboot
      Suse: /srv/tftpboot
    tftp_directory: "{{ _tftp_directory[ansible_distribution ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]\
      \ | default(_tftp_directory[ansible_os_family] | default(_tftp_directory['default']))\
      \ }}"
    tftp_client_package: tftp
  handlers:
    - name: uninstall tftp client
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ tftp_client_package }}"
        state: absent
    - name: remove test
      ansible.builtin.file:
        path: "{{ tftp_directory }}/test"
        state: absent
  tasks:
    - name: Install tftp client
      ansible.builtin.package:
        name: "{{ tftp_client_package }}"
        state: present
      notify:
        - uninstall tftp client
    - name: Touch {{ tftp_directory }}/test
      ansible.builtin.file:
        path: "{{ tftp_directory }}/test"
        mode: "0777"
        state: touch
      notify:
        - remove test
    - name: Put /etc/passwd to test
      ansible.builtin.command:
        cmd: tftp localhost -c put /etc/passwd test

- name: Verify
  hosts: molecule_hosts
  tasks:
    - name: Check users - get data
      ansible.windows.win_shell: Get-ADUser -Identity {{ user }} -Properties Description,
        GivenName, Surname, EmailAddress, LockedOut, SamAccountName, UserPrincipalName,
        City, Company | ConvertTo-Json
      loop:
        - "{{ win_domain_users_tests_ad_user }}-a"
        - "{{ win_domain_users_tests_ad_user }}-b"
        - "{{ win_domain_users_tests_ad_user }}-c"
        - "{{ win_domain_users_tests_ad_user }}-e"
        - "{{ win_domain_users_tests_ad_user }}-f"
        - "{{ win_domain_users_tests_ad_user }}-g"
      loop_control:
        loop_var: user
      changed_when: false
      ignore_errors: true
      register: users_result
    - name: Check users
      ansible.builtin.assert:
        quiet: true
        that:
          - user.Description == desired[user.SamAccountName].Description
          - user.GivenName == desired[user.SamAccountName].GivenName
          - user.Surname == desired[user.SamAccountName].Surname
          - user.EmailAddress == desired[user.SamAccountName].EmailAddress
          - user.LockedOut == desired[user.SamAccountName].LockedOut

            Enabled: true
